channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold is approaching $5,000, and ‘unavoidable uncertainty’ means it could go higher
item.description: RBC’s head of commodities says there could be paths even higher for gold in a “real risk-off scenario.”

item.title: Nvidia’s on-and-off China relationship appears to be on again
item.description: The on-and-off saga involving Nvidia and China appears to be back on again, after a report that China’s government has given the go-ahead to big compa...

item.title: Natural gas prices have overshot as deep freeze hits the U.S., says Goldman
item.description: Goldman Sachs thinks the current natural gas price reflects a temporary imbalance and should eventually correct.

item.title: ‘It’s my money’: My $800K inheritance is paying for a $1.6 million house. Shouldn’t I decide where my husband and I live?
item.description: ‘My husband and I have been together for 25 years. We have two children’

item.title: The case for a U.S. bear market was building even before Trump antagonized overseas investors
item.description: There are two important measures that point to a downturn for stocks, according to Longview Economics.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
